resources.name: yield_data

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. It will generally have been sown the previous year, eg the 1968 crop was sown in autumn 1967.

fields.name: strip
fields.title: strip
fields.description: Treatment strips which extend the whole length of the field and receive the different fertilizer and manure treatments (1-22). There is no Strip 4. Current Strip 21 also known as 2.1, 2a or 2A, current Strip 22 also known as 2.2, 2b or 2B. Strip 1 (Sections 2-7) was started in 1968.

fields.name: section
fields.title: Section number 1968 onwards
fields.description: Since 1968 the treatment strips have been divided into 10 Sections (0-9) some in continuous wheat (0, 1, 6, 8 and 9) and some in rotation with non-wheat crops (2-5, 7, see previous crop). Since 1986 Section 0 has had straw incorporated. Section 6 was in a rotation of fallow>wheat>wheat 1968-1979, and reverted to continuous winter wheat in 1980 with no spring or summer fungicides. Herbicides have been used as required since 1964 on all of the experiment, except for Section 8 (old Section VA), which has never received herbicides. See plans for further details.

fields.name: plot
fields.title: plot
fields.description: Unique whole plot number, determined by Strip (1-22) and Section (0-9) number

fields.name: section_1926-67
fields.title: section 1926-1967
fields.description: Previous Section name, 1926-1967. Originally five Sections (I-V).  1926-1954, Section I divided into IA and IB in 1955, Section V divided in VA and VB in 1955.

fields.name: fertilizer_code
fields.title: fertilizer and manure treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied in that harvest year

fields.name: cropping
fields.title: cropping
fields.description: Cropping in that harvest year:  winter wheat, fallow (no crop, cultivated several times to remove weeds), spring wheat which was grown in some years when it was too wet to sow the usual winter wheat in the autumn. See crop_types_data for more information.

fields.name: year_of_wheat
fields.title: year of wheat
fields.description: Number of years since last non-wheat crop or fallow.

fields.name: previous_crop
fields.title: previous crop
fields.description: Crop grown in previous harvest year: winter wheat, fallow (no crop, cultivated to remove weeds), oats, potatoes, forage maize or field beans. See crop_types_data for more information.

fields.name: straw_incorporation
fields.title: straw incorporation
fields.description: Whether wheat straw cut by the combine was incorporated (yes) or removed (no) after harvest. Removed from all sections except Section 0, when it was incorporated from 1986 onwards. Stubble and part of the chaff retained on all plots.

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the farmyard manure (FYM) factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fym_applied
fields.title: FYM applied
fields.description: Amount of farmyard manure (FYM) applied in that harvest year

fields.name: fym_date
fields.title: Date FYM applied
fields.description: Date farmyard manure (FYM) applied, usually in the autumn

fields.name: castor_meal_factor_level
fields.title: Castor meal factor level
fields.description: Code for the castor mean factor level applied in that harvest year. Before 1941 rape cake.

fields.name: castor_meal_n_applied
fields.title: Castor meal N applied
fields.description: Amount of N applied in the castor bean meal

fields.name: castor_meal_date
fields.title: Date castor meal applied
fields.description: Date castor bean meal applied, usually in the autumn

fields.name: n_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: n_timing
fields.title: Timing of fertilizer N
fields.description: When inorganic nitrogen fertilizer was applied: either all in autumn (autumn), all in spring (spring) or a combination of autumn and spring (autumn_&_spring). The spring N is either applied as a single application in mid-spring, or in two or three applications in early, mid or late spring (approximately March, April and May).

fields.name: autumn_n_kg/ha
fields.title: Fertilizer N applied in autumn
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer treatments applied in the autumn to this crop. This does not include N applied in other treatments (FYM or castor meal).

fields.name: autumn_n_date
fields.title: Date fertilizer N applied in autumn
fields.description: Date inorganic fertilizer nitrogen applied in the autumn

fields.name: spring1_n_kg/ha
fields.title: First spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in first application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM or castor meal.

fields.name: spring1_n_date
fields.title: First spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date first application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring.

fields.name: spring2_n_kg/ha
fields.title: Second spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in second application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM or castor meal.

fields.name: spring2_n_date
fields.title: Second spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date second application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring.

fields.name: spring3_n_kg/ha
fields.title: Third spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in third (final) application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM or castor meal.

fields.name: spring3_n_date
fields.title: Third spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date third (final) application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring.

fields.name: total_fertilizer_n_amount
fields.title: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in autumn and spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM or castor meal.

fields.name: p_factor_level
fields.title: P factor level
fields.description: Code for the phosphorous (P) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: p_amount
fields.title: P amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic P fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include P in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: p_date
fields.title: P fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic P fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: k_factor_level
fields.title: K factor level
fields.description: Code for the potassium (K) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: k_amount
fields.title: K amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic K fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include K in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: k_date
fields.title: K fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic K fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: na_factor_level
fields.title: Na factor level
fields.description: Code for the sodium (Na) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: na_amount
fields.title: Na amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic Na fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include Na in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: na_date
fields.title: Na fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic Na fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: mg_factor_level
fields.title: Mg factor level
fields.description: Code for the magnesium (Mg) fertilizer factor level applied in that harvest year

fields.name: mg_amount
fields.title: Mg amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic Mg fertilizer applied in that harvest year. This does not include Mg in FYM or castor bean meal.

fields.name: mg_date
fields.title: Mg fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic Mg fertilizer applied in that harvest year.

fields.name: sow_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown, generally in the autumn in the year before harvest

fields.name: harvest_date
fields.title: Harvest date
fields.description: Date the crop was harvested

fields.name: cultivar
fields.title: Cultivar
fields.description: Wheat cultivar or variety

fields.name: grain
fields.title: Grain yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat grain yield at 85% dry matter.

fields.name: straw
fields.title: Straw yield
fields.description: Harvested wheat straw yield at 85% dry matter. Straw does not include stubble. Since 1980 straw yield has been recorded regularly for Section 1 and the 1st wheat in rotation only each year, with some other sections in other years.

fields.name: note
fields.title: Note
fields.description: Whether notes are applied or not

resources.title: crop yield data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual winter wheat grain and straw yield data for all plots, and details of all fertilizer and manure treatments, 1968-2022. Also other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, amount, type and date of application of treatments, and wheat cultivars. The Broadbalk Wheat Experiment was started in autumn 1843 to investigate the effects of fertilizers containing N, P, K, Na and Mg in various combinations, and organic manure, on the yield of winter wheat grown continuously. The treatment STRIPS (3-22) extend the whole length of the field; each strip tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. In 1926 the strips were divided into five SECTIONS (I-V), bare fallowed in sequence to control weeds. There were further divisions in 1955 making seven Sections (IA-VB). In 1968 the strips were divided into 10 SECTIONS (0-9) and Strip 1 (Sections 2-7 only) was added.  Each PLOT is a unique strip\section combination. Sections 0, 1, 8 and 9 remained in continuous winter wheat. In Sections 2-7 wheat was grown rotation with other arable crops (potatoes, beans, oats or forage maize) and fallow. In 1979 Section 6 reverted to continuous wheat. Section 0 has had straw incorporated each year since 1986; straw is removed from all other sections. Section 8 has never received herbicides; it is bare fallowed every 5-8 years to control weeds. Section 6 has had restricted pesticide use since 1985 (no spring or summer fungicides). Since 1980 straw yield has been recorded regularly for Section 1 and the 1st wheat in rotation only each year, with some other sections in other years. Yields of non-wheat crops are published separately. See notes and section names.pdf for full details of layout and the cropping plans for details of the different crop rotations.

name: broadbalk-wheat-experiment-wheat-grain-and-straw-yields-1968-2022
title: Broadbalk Wheat Experiment wheat grain and straw yields 1968-2022
description:
### Abstract
Annual winter wheat grain and straw yields for each treatment plot of the Broadbalk Wheat Experiment, 1968-2022, with details of all fertilizer and manure applications. Also other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, and winter wheat cultivars.
### Methods
The Broadbalk Wheat Experiment was started in autumn 1843 to investigate the effects of fertilizers containing N, P, K, Na and Mg in various combinations, and organic manure, on the yield of winter wheat grown continuously. The treatment STRIPS (3-22) extend the whole length of the field; each strip tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. In 1926 the strips were divided into five SECTIONS (I-V), bare fallowed in sequence to control weeds. There were further divisions in 1955 making seven Sections (IA-VB). Each PLOT is a unique strip\section combination. In 1968 the experiment was divided into ten Sections (0-9), to allow the comparison of wheat grown continuously with wheat in a three or five-year rotation. Strip 1 was added in 1968, on Sections 2-7 only. 
Sections 0, 1, 8 and 9 remained in continuous winter wheat. In Sections 2-7 wheat was grown in rotation with other arable crops (potatoes, beans, oats or forage maize) and fallow. In 1979 Section 6 reverted to continuous wheat. Section 0 has had straw incorporated each year since 1986; straw is removed from all other sections. Section 8 has never received herbicides; it is bare fallowed every 5-8 years to control weeds. Section 6 has had restricted pesticide use since 1985 (no spring or summer fungicides). Yields from non-wheat crops are published separately. See section_names.pdf for full details of layout and the cropping plans for details of the different crop rotations.
### Technical Info
Wheat and straw yields are at 85% dry matter. Straw yield is that part of the straw cut by the combine harvester, and does not include the stubble or all of the chaff. Since 1980 straw yield has been recorded regularly for Section 1 and the 1st wheat in rotation only each year, with some other sections in other years. In fallow years the plots were cultivated to kill weeds. No N fertilizer was applied, but FYM and PKNaMg applied as usual. Fallow (no crop) yields are shown as blank cells.  
Strip 21 was also known as 2.1, 2a and 2A; strip 22 was also known as 2.2, 2b and 2B. By convention, the year is that of harvest (not sowing).
### Other
Many other Rothamsted staff have been involved in the production of this data, including farm staff, field recorders, laboratory staff and data recorders, too numerous to mention.
### Provenance
Yields of grain and straw are from the BKYIELD_R85 datasets in the e-RA database. Treatment details were taken from the Rothamsted Yield Books, published each year with details of each experiment.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued. This procedure also set out how to handle situations where the written records were illegible or ambiguous. This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate. Once the data were entered into e-RA, they were independently back-checked against the original data sheets.
